metadata.title: 802.11: SSID Confusion attack (important)
metadata.description:
DOCUMENTATION: A flaw was found in the IEEE 802.11 standard. This vulnerability possibly allows an adversary to trick a victim into connecting to an unintended or untrusted network because the SSID is not always used to derive the pairwise master key or session keys and because there is not a protected exchange of an SSID during a 4-way handshake. 
            STATEMENT: This vulnerability affects networks using the WEP,  WPA3 SAE-loop, 802.1x/EAP, FILS, and Mesh AMPE authentication protocols.
            MITIGATION: null

criterions.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9 is installed
NetworkManager is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
